snippet: Mr. Meyers is the first of his broadcast network peers to dispense with the stand-up comedy monologue, substituting instead a format that more closely resembles “Weekend Update” on “Saturday Night Live.”
abstract: Comedian Seth Meyers dispenses with opening stand-up monologue traditionally delivered by late night talk show hosts; opens NBC show Late Night, which he has hosted for two years, with monologue delivered from behind his desk.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Meyers is the first of his broadcast network peers to dispense with the stand-up comedy monologue, substituting instead a format that more closely resembles “Weekend Update” on “Saturday Night Live.”

headline.main: Seth Meyers Decides to Take a Seat to Deliver His ‘Late Night’ Monologue
headline.print_headline: Still Comedy, but No Longer Stand-Up

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)
